mods.abstract: Correspondence concerning the question of Iranian rights to search foreign vessels outside their territorial waters. The papers cover the report of such an incident involving dhows from Dubai and the interdepartmental discussion of what rights the Iranians have and what action should be taken should such a thing occur again. Correspondence comes from officials at the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf, the British Legation in Tehran, the India Office, and the Foreign Office.
